Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: L0veAdventure
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, helpful staff - two brothers - who spoke English fluently. They were only too happy to help us with any little thing. The rooms were VERY clean. Clean bedsheets and towels everyday. TV and fan in the room. Bathroom was clean also.Offered us transfers - we ended up getting our own however. Breakfast was a lovely coffee and pastry choice - this is the only thing that let the trip down however; nice food but in a not so nice shop - rude staff...

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, it has BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Cali41588
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Left with over 100 bed bug bites covering my arms, ears, and back. My girlfriend had 50 bed bug bites on her back. The bites are big and red, take long to heal, and they itch to the point where you want to scream. The maids don't change your sheets in between nights. Save yourselves from this awful experience and do not stay here. This place ruined our vacation. I'm hoping the bed bugs did not travel home with us in our luggage. Also, there is no breakfast. The TV was broken. The elevator is really small, old, and scary because it looks like it will get stuck or snap. The place is really dark and you never see anybody. The night staff does not speak English. The bathroom stinks and the floor is always flooded by the bidet.

Reviews.Title: “Returned for the third time.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingJohnD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and have always been satisfied. The location is perfect for my needs (train station, food and entertainment). The neighbor feels safe, is quiet at night and there is a little store around the corner where you can buy water and snacks until late. Most importantly, it is clean. I am not looking for luxury but I like the street view from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: beebahk
Reviews.Content: I actually found the staff quite friendly overall. Lukas treated me very well when I checked in -- and his command of English was almost like a native! The location is good and convenient. As for the breakfast, I am reading comments from others -- but that's Italian breakfast for you!! They are not big breakfast people like, say, the English of the Americans. For a brief stay it was sufficient for me. I would stay there again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here- night staff dont speak english, very excitable during check in - spoke to me constantly in Italian”
Reviews.Author: Travebkaman
Reviews.Content: Poor service rubbish breakfast good location I wouldnt stay here again If u call a slice of cake and a coffee breakfast then stay here Staff on phone seemed pleasent(Randy) The others were rude, short and dismissive Asked for an adaptor for my laptop Staff went into back office and could here everything flying around whilst he looked for one which didnt even work!

Reviews.Title: “bare bones basic”
Reviews.Author: halitozis
Reviews.Content: The plusses - good location - 10 mins walk from Termini train station and 30 min walk to Pantheon; rooms are clean; decent price; wifi access. The negatives - even though it's on the 5th floor - it's loud (but this is Rome); hot water showers last 45 seconds; absolutely zero cozy atmosphere. All in all - it's a decent choice for the low-maintenance traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Forget breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hovite
Reviews.Content: This was booked for me by my travelling companion, so I didn't bother to check reviews. Now I wish that I had. The review by jmisdraji would have warned me what to expect. The worst part was the breakfast. A voucher was supplied that got you a coffee and a croissant in a nearby bar, with tables by a busy road. It really wasn't worth bothering with. Almost as annoying were various problems with the plumbing. The sink leaked, so a towel had been put underneath to catch the drips; a better idea would have been to get it fixed. The mechanical plug was jammed ajar; it could neither be completed closed nor properly opened. It was eventually removed leaving just the gaping hole. The shower head was faulty but was replaced with a new one. For reasons that never became clear, the shower sometimes failed to produce hot water. Most oddly of all, the towels always seem to smell of vinegar. Finally, the room was a bit dirty. There was dust on the floor and in drawers. My advice: spend a little more and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can.”
Reviews.Author: jmisdraji
Reviews.Content: I chose Ares Rooms because it was supposed to be a reasonably priced, centrally located gay rooming house. Where to begin. The room was modest, a bit cramped, no A/C. Bathroom was one towel only, no face cloths, etc. So you get the point - no frills. But that isn't the issue. The hallways were a bit dark, and you never saw other guests, so you never get the sense of its being "gay". In fact, the only indication of its being a gay friendly hotel was that they had those maps of gay bars in town...that's it. The staff sit at a desk and by turns either spoke minimal English or, even worse, were unfamiliar with restaurants in the area, and were overall not too helpful. When I was trying to find Ares by car and called them, the guy at the desk was curt and unpleasant. This was confirmed when we got there and I sent my partner to ask a question of him, and my partner returned saying "I see what you mean". The kind of person who, when you ask a follow up question because you are confused, just repeats the same information more loudly and forcefully, as though that makes it more clear. Breakfast is a coupon for a cup of coffee and a pastry at a nearby tiny "bar" (there was no seating - you ate at a small counter) so it's very "on the go". To be fair, the 3rd day, they had a bit of seating outside, but it was all taken, so we still ate at the small counter. As for location, it is located reasonably well to the colosseum, but frankly, there are so many attractions in Rome that almost any hotel can claim to be well located, so as long as you are in the central Rome area, you can't go too wrong on location. And on my last evening, my partner and I were going out for dinner, so I left 2 50-euro bills on the desktop, to avoid taking too much cash with me. When I returned, one was missing. I can't prove the staff took it, but since you have to turn in your key to them when you are out, and you have to ring the doorbell for entry, I think we can safely assume that they had plenty of opportunity to enter the room unseen and take the cash. Why not all of it? I am not a conspiracy theorist by nature, but I suspect that is the M.O. of the perpetrator, so that he can say you must have miscounted. My suggestion to you is that in Rome, splurge just a bit more for your hotel room, and if the gay thing is important to you, do not for one second think that Ares will fulfill that desire.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, central”
Reviews.Author: northlondonbirder
Reviews.Content: Ares Rooms was a good find - very central, a few minutes walk from Termini station and we were able to check in mid-morning. The room was clean and well-presented. Two criticisms though; there was no soap or hand towel in either of the two bathroom. Also, the owner/staff weren't overly friendly - when we arrived they seemed positively stressed out at dealing with several enquiries at once. They were also rather eager to relieve us of our money mid-way through our stay! I would recommend this place, but not for the service, more for the convenience and cleanliness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central location that's all”
Reviews.Author: TCARBONNEL
Reviews.Content: The pension is well located, however there are a bit of positive and negative points : - breakfast is not served at the pension but in a Cafe closed to the pension. The breakfast is very poor in an unpleasant cafe actually. - room are clean, and very silent and quieted - a nasty odour in the bathroom was really an issue - no wireless internet connection or internet connection All in all a bit expensive and disapointing.

HotelInfo.Name: Ares Rooms
HotelInfo.Address: Via Domenichino 7, 00187 Rome, Italy
